III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Compliance with the child protection law
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12214
Section • (1) An agency shall comply with the child protection law,
Description 1975 PA 238, MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The agency failed to report an incident of suspected
abuse/neglect that occurred while a child had an unsupervised
visit with a parent.
Investigation On 4/23/24 Complainant reported an allegation that someone
inserted a rock into Youth A’s bottom. This reportedly occurred on
4/7/24 while Youth A was visiting his mother. The agency failed to
report this allegation to Centralized Intake until 4/19/24.
Interviews:
Chief Administrator was contacted via email on 4/24/24. Chief
Administrator did not have any direct knowledge of the incident
and provided contact information for involved staff. Chief
Administrator did not have any additional questions.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via Teams on 4/26/24.
Foster Care Worker reported she was informed of the concern by
Foster Parent on 4/7/24. Foster Parent called that evening and
reported Youth A said a “rock bug went into his bottom”. Foster
Parent reported Youth A did not provide any other information, but
she observed that his bottom was itchy. Foster Care Worker
instructed Foster Parent to take Youth A to the doctor to
determine if he was bitten by a bug, or if something else was
causing the itch.
Foster Care Worker visited Youth A the following day to attempt to
gather additional information. When asked for more information,
Youth A answered that he did not know what a “rock bug” was, or
how it got there. Youth A could not describe the rock bug and did
not report that anyone touched him or put anything in his body.
Youth A was seen by Pediatrician on 4/8/24. Pediatrician did not
identify any concerns from the physical exam. As Youth A denied
knowing what a rock bug was and did not report anyone touched
him, Foster Care Worker did not believe there was alleged abuse
to report. Foster Care Worker stated she did not have any other
2

information that would cause her to suspect abuse occurred while
Youth A visited his mother. In addition, Foster Parent reported to
Foster Care Worker that Youth A had been itching his bottom for
several days, prior to the visit with his mother. The discomfort with
his bottom was not something new from the visit.
Foster Care Worker was unsure of where the information came
from that was later reported to DHHS, regarding someone putting
a rock in Youth A’s behind. Foster Care Worker stated Youth A
never made that statement to her.
Program Manager was interviewed via Teams on 4/29/24.
Program Manager stated Foster Parent called the agency on-call
phone on 4/7/24 to report a concern about Youth A. Foster Parent
was unable to reach someone via the on-call phone and contacted
Foster Care Supervisor directly to report the concern. Foster Care
Supervisor notified Foster Care Worker, who then contacted
Foster Parent to discuss next steps. Program Manager did not
directly speak with Foster Parent. After the call, Foster Care
Worker reached out to Foster Parent to gather additional
information. Foster Care Worker informed Program Manager that
Youth A had itching and soreness in his bottom. A medical
appointment was scheduled to determine what was causing the
problem. The medical evaluation was completed on 4/8/24 and did
not note any concerns.
On 4/19/24 Program Manager was informed an investigation had
been initiated by DHHS regarding Youth A’s Mother. The DHHS
intake stated “a rock was inserted” in Youth A’s bottom. Program
Manager spoke with Foster Care Worker to gather additional
information. The Foster Care Worker stated the information she
received from Foster Parent and Youth A, did not match the
DHHS intake. Although, the information differed from the DHHS
intake, Program Manager decided to call Centralized Intake to
make a report.
Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed via Teams on
4/29/24. Foster Care Supervisor reported that she received a call
from Foster Parent after Youth A returned to the home from
visiting his mother on 4/7/24. Per Foster Parent, when Youth A
was asked to take a bath, he refused, and indicated his bottom
hurt. Foster Parent reported Youth A said a “rock bug went in his
behind”. Youth A did not state anyone put it there and did not
state when it happened. Foster Parent could not elaborate as
Youth A did not provide any further information. Per Foster Parent,
Youth A was scratching and digging at his bottom for a few days
prior to the visit with his mother. Youth A took an oatmeal bath to
alleviate the itching and Foster Parent scheduled an appointment
3

with his doctor. Youth A saw Pediatrician the following day, 4/8/24.
Pediatrician did not find anything of concern.
Foster Care Supervisor spoke with Youth A’s Mother and asked if
she was aware of any reason why Youth A was itching his bottom.
Youth A’s Mother stated Youth A has very dry skin and itches at
times. Youth A had an ointment that was used at home, but it was
currently out. A follow-up call occurred with Foster Parent, where it
was determined they would change the laundry detergent and
address the dry skin.
A few days later, Foster Care Supervisor became aware of the
DHHS investigation where the allegation stated someone “put a
rock in” Youth A’s bottom. Foster Care Supervisor stated she was
not sure where that information came from as, to her knowledge,
Youth A never said someone put a rock in his bottom. Youth A
never expressed anyone touched him or put anything near or in
his body. Youth A did not name any people or identify a time when
anything was put in his bottom.
Therapist was interviewed by phone on 5/21/24. Therapist
confirmed Youth A as a client. Therapist stated she was informed
by Foster Parent that Youth A said a hard rock was “put in” his
bottom. Therapist attempted to discuss this with Youth A.
However, Youth A did not provide any additional information.
Foster Parent was interviewed by phone on 5/24/24. Foster
Parent was asked to clarify what Youth A specifically said about
his bottom. Foster Parent reported Youth A said it was a “rock
bug” not a rock. When Foster Parent asked questions to
understand what Youth A meant, Youth A guessed that someone
must have put a rock bug in his bottom while he was sleeping.
Youth A described the rock bug as being hard and brown. Foster
Parent stated with Youth A only being 5 years old, she was unsure
if he was referring to a hard piece of feces, or something else.
Youth A never indicated his mother did anything and did not
identify any other person that was present. Youth A did not say
when this occurred. Youth A did not say what happened to the
“rock bug”. Youth A answered most clarifying questions with “I
don’t know”.
Foster Parent contacted the agency on 4/7/24 and reported Youth
A said a “rock bug went in his butt”. Foster Parent was unclear
about what that meant but wanted to notify the agency. As she
discussed with Foster Care Worker on the phone, she mentioned
that Youth A had some itching in his bottom over the past few
days, prior to visiting his mother. Foster Care Worker advised
Foster Parent to take Youth A to the doctor to make sure there
wasn’t a bug bit or other skin condition that needed to be treated.
4

Foster Parent took Youth A to Pediatrician to be examined on
4/8/24; they did not find anything of concern.
Foster Parent added that Youth A’s mother reported the child had
a history of being itchy at times due to dry skin. Foster Parent
bathed Youth A in an oatmeal bath and changed the brand of
laundry detergent. There have been no further issues with Youth
A itching or mention of “rock bugs”.
Documents Reviewed:
• Human Resources file for Foster Care Worker- There was
no disciplinary action on file for this staff regarding the Child
Protection Law.
• Case Contacts-
o 4/7/24 Foster Care Supervisor received a phone call
from Foster Parent. Foster Parent reported Youth A
said a “rock bug” went in his butt. However, he did
not provide any clarification.
o 4/8/24 Foster Care Worker spoke with Foster
Parent. Youth A was itching his bottom and stated a
“rock bug got inside”.
o 4/8/24 Foster Care Supervisor called Youth A’s
Mother and she did not know what a rock bug was.
She reported Youth A had been itching, but she did
not know if it was a bug bite or dry skin.
o 4/19/24 Foster Care Worker informed of DHHS
investigation. Foster Care Worker contacted Youth
A’s Mother and Foster Parent to discuss the safety
plan.
o 4/22/24 Foster Care Worker spoke with Youth A.
Youth A stated he did not know what a rock bug
was. Youth A did not provide any additional
information.
• Letter from Pediatrician dated 4/11/24- Youth A was seen
in the office on 4/8/24 with Foster Parent. Youth A was
evaluated for pain in the buttocks. No medication or labs
were ordered. No concerns were noted.
• Incident Report completed by Foster Care Worker on
4/23/24- The incident report was consistent with the case
contact in MiSACWIS.
• Incident Report completed by Foster Care Supervisor on
4/22/24- The incident report was consistent with the
information provided in the interview on 4/29/24.
• DHHS intake dated 4/18/24. DHHS Worker contacted
Foster Parent. Foster Parent reported Youth A said while
he was asleep at his mother’s home “a rock bug got
5

pushed up his butt”. Youth A reported that only his mother
was in the home when he visited.
• DHHS case contact on 4/22/24- During an interview Youth
A reported he stayed at his mother’s home overnight and
slept in his own bed, but then went into his mother’s
bedroom and watched television. Youth A was asked about
the rock bug. Youth A denied knowing what a rock bug was
and stated he never said those words.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as interviews with Foster
Parent and agency staff concluded the agency did not suspect
abuse when they initially received information from Foster Parent
on 4/7/24. Therefore, a report was not made to centralized intake.
All interviews determined Foster Parent initially reported that
Youth A said a “rock bug” went in his bottom. This is different from
the third-hand information reported to DHHS on 4/18/24 that
stated “someone inserted a rock” in Youth A's bottom while visiting
his mother.
When agency staff initially attempted to gain clarification about the
“rock bug”, Youth A could not explain what it was and did not
indicate involvement by anyone else. No one observed a rock or
rock bug, and Pediatrician did not observe any physical signs that
would have indicated possible abuse. In addition, Foster Parent
and Youth A’s Mother reported Youth A was itching his behind for
several days prior to visiting his mother, indicating the itching
behavior was not caused by something that occurred during the
visit.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
